meanings.definition: Firmly or closely fixed in place; not easily moved
meanings.sent1: The lid on the jar was tighter than before, making it hard to open.
meanings.sent2: She tied the knot tighter to ensure it wouldn't come undone.
meanings.sent3: The cat squeezed into the tighter space behind the couch, pretending to be invisible.
meanings.sent4: His grip on the steering wheel grew tighter as the storm raged outside.
meanings.sent5: The hug from her friend was tighter than she had ever felt, conveying comfort and support.

meanings.definition: Strict or stringent in discipline or control
meanings.sent1: The teacher had a tighter rule about homework submission this semester.
meanings.sent2: The security at the event was tighter than usual due to recent incidents.
meanings.sent3: The coach's tighter training regimen pushed the team to their limits.
meanings.sent4: The new manager implemented tighter policies to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The company had to adopt tighter security measures after the data breach.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of generosity or willingness to spend money
meanings.sent1: His tighter approach to finances meant fewer spontaneous purchases.
meanings.sent2: She had a reputation for being tighter with money than her friends.
meanings.sent3: The tighter budget forced them to get creative with their spending.
meanings.sent4: The tighter accountant scrutinized every expense to cut costs.
meanings.sent5: Their tighter attitude towards money saved them from unnecessary debt.

meanings.definition: Of a close or intimate nature
meanings.sent1: Their friendship grew tighter as they shared more personal stories.
meanings.sent2: The family had a tighter bond after overcoming a difficult situation together.
meanings.sent3: The tighter connection between them made it easy to communicate without words.
meanings.sent4: The couple's relationship became tighter after going through challenges together.
meanings.sent5: The team's tighter camaraderie helped them achieve victory in the championship.

meanings.definition: Of a close or compact structure
meanings.sent1: The tighter arrangement of the furniture made the room feel cozy.
meanings.sent2: The tighter design of the backpack allowed for more storage space.
meanings.sent3: The tighter packaging kept the fragile items safe during shipping.
meanings.sent4: The tighter weave of the fabric prevented any light from passing through.
meanings.sent5: The tighter formation of the group made them look more organized and united.
